title: VMware Introduces Virtualization
overview: VMware launches its first virtualization products, enabling multiple operating systems to run on a single physical machine â€” the foundation for modern cloud computing.

title: Amazon Web Services (AWS) Launches
overview: Amazon launches AWS with S3 and EC2, pioneering the cloud services market and enabling scalable, on-demand computing.

title: Google Cloud Platform
overview: Google enters the cloud market with App Engine, later expanding into GCP, offering computing, storage, and advanced AI services.

title: VMware vSphere
overview: VMware launches vSphere, bringing enterprise-grade virtualization management and clustering for large-scale deployments.

title: Microsoft Azure
overview: Microsoft launches Azure as a competitor to AWS and GCP, growing into one of the largest global cloud platforms.

title: Docker Popularizes Containers
overview: Docker makes containerization accessible, transforming software deployment and scaling, and revolutionizing DevOps practices.

title: Kubernetes
overview: Google open-sources Kubernetes, which quickly becomes the standard for container orchestration and cloud-native infrastructure.

title: Serverless Computing Expansion
overview: Serverless offerings like AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, and Azure Functions expand rapidly, redefining application development models.
